quiz.text: Ten persons are sitting in two parallel rows containing five persons in each. In row 1, F, G, H, N and J are sitting, facing south. In row 2, U, V, W, X and Y are sitting, facing north. All of them like different colors. Who among them likes Pink? I. There is only one person sits between Y and V. The immediate neighbor of J faces Y, who likes green and does not sit at an extreme end. II. The one, who likes red, sits third to the left of J and one of them sits to the extreme end of the row. The immediate neighbor of J faces the person, who likes pink color. Y sits two places away from the one, who likes orange.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I alone or in statement II is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and statement II are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and statement II together are necessary to answer the question.

All of these

With only 10 crore persons in the 45 plus category having received their first doses, and even fewer 2. 3 crore their second doses, immediate prospects are not good for the 59 crore population in the 18-44 group. I. Daily vaccine production is way beyond the supply needed to fulfil the requirement of the states. II. Daily vaccine production is no way near to the supply needed to fulfil the requirement of the states. III. The centre has earmarked vaccine supply for its priority groups returning for second doses.

Only II
Both I and II
Both II and III
Only III

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are incorrect with respect to the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)?                                                                                                                                                                         

A. There is provision for additional 100 days of unskilled wage employment in a financial year in drought/natural calamity notified rural areas.

B. It provides not less than 100 days of unskilled manual work as a guaranteed employment in a financial year to every person in rural areas as per demand.

C. Ministry of Rural Development conducts social audit to ensure accountability.
options: A and B
Only A
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the Kisan Credit Card (KCC) Scheme? 

A. Minimum age to enrol is 18 years, maximum being 65 years.

B. No collateral is required for loans up to Rs. 1.60 lakh 

C. Small finance banks are not allowed to provide loan under KCC.
options: A and B
Only A
B and C
Only B
A and C

quiz.text: Which one among the followings is the Nodal Agency of the Design Linked Incentive (DLI) Scheme?
options: Software Technology Parks of India
India Semiconductor Mission
MeitY Startup Hub
C-DAC (Centre for Development of Advanced Computing)
None of the above

quiz.text: Outlay for PM Awas Yojana is being enhanced by ____ to over Rs. 79,000 crore in Union Budget 2023-24?
options: 66%
56%
50%
76%
60%

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana?

A. The scheme was launched in 2015.

B. No additional funds are allocated under this scheme.

C. The MP would be free to identify a suitable Gram Panchayat to be developed as Adarsh Gram, other than his/her own village or that of his/her spouse.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which among following statement/s is/are incorrect with respect to the Pradhan Mantri PVTG Development Mission?

A. Fund of Rs 10,000 crore for the next three years has been allocated for the socio-economic development of the group.

B. There are 50 PVTG groups spread across 18 states and the UT of Andaman & Nicobar Island in India.

C. Pradhan Mantri PVTG Development Mission has been initiated to saturate the PVTG families and habitations with basic facilities.
options: A and B
A and C
Only B
B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to PM-SVANidhi Scheme?

A. It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme

B. NABARD acts as the implementing agency for this scheme

C. Aadhar card is mandatory to enrol in SVANidhi
options: A and B
B and C
A only
B only
C only
